Judul: Underlying Structure of Collective Bands and Self-Organization in Quantum Systems
Abstrak:
The underlying structure of low-lying collective bands of atomic nuclei is discussed from a novel
perspective on the interplay between single-particle and collective degrees of freedom, by utilizing state-of-the-art configuration interaction calculations on heavy nuclei. Besides the multipole components of the
nucleon-nucleon interaction that drive collective modes forming those bands, the monopole component is
shown to control the resistance against such modes. The calculated structure of 154Sm corresponds to the
coexistence between prolate and triaxial shapes, while that of 166Er exhibits a deformed shape with a strong triaxial instability. Both findings differ from traditional views based on ?=? vibrations. The formation of
collective bands is shown to be facilitated from a self-organization mechanism.
Kontributor / Dosen Pembimbing: Y. Tsunoda, T. Abe, N. Shimizu,  and P. Van Duppen
Fakultas: Fakultas Matematika dan Ilmu Pengetahuan Alam
